Docs.summary: Provides data for the and events of a control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.ItemCreated> event is raised when an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control is created.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.ItemDataBound> event is raised when an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control is data bound to a source.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of DataListItemEventArgs, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to define a handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.ItemDataBound> event. This example specifies the event handler declaratively, setting the event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.OnItemDataBound%2A> attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control.

## Remarks The items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control are referenced as each item is created or bound to the control. Use this property to programmatically access the referenced item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.ItemCreated> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList.ItemDataBound> event is raised.
